intro: Hieracium asymmetricum, commonly known as the asymmetric hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and disturbed soils, displaying yellow to orange flowers that attract pollinators. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Hieracium asymmetricum is known for its ability to spread through rhizomes, making it a persistent weed in certain environments.
